text: Amaury Antônio Pasos (December 11, 1935 – December 12, 2024), also commonly known simply as Amaury, was a Brazilian basketball player and coach. He was born in São Paulo, Brazil. He competed at three Olympic Games, winning two bronze medals in 1960 and 1964. He was honored into the FIBA Hall of Fame in 2007. Pasos died on December 12, 2024 in São Paulo, one day after this 89th birthday. ==References== ==Other websites== * Amaury Pasos at the Confederação Brasileira de Basketball (archived) * Amaury Pasos at the FIBA Hall of Fame Category:1935 births Category:2024 deaths Category:Brazilian basketball players Category:Centers (basketball) Category:Medalists at the 1956 Summer Olympics Category:Medalists at the 1960 Summer Olympics Category:Medalists at the 1964 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic bronze medalists for Brazil Category:Point guards Category:Power forwards Category:Sportspeople from São Paulo
title: Amaury Pasos
